channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Anita Bryant, Whose Anti-Gay Politics Undid a Singing Career, Is Dead at 84
item.description: The former beauty queen and spokeswoman for Florida orange juice was an all-American entertainer before she began crusading against L.G.B.T.Q. rights.

item.title: Jeff Bezos’ Blue Origin to debut new rocket in SpaceX challenge
item.description: New Glenn, originally intended to launch as early as 2020, is slated to fly on Sunday out of Cape Canaveral, Florida, during a nearly four-hour launch...

item.title: With Hearings Imminent, Partisan Fight Escalates Over Trump Cabinet
item.description: Democrats are demanding that Republicans slow consideration of picks for the new administration until they can review background checks, as the G.O.P....

item.title: Kremlin Confirms Readiness for Putin to Meet Trump
item.description: The president-elect had said the Russian leader wanted to meet him to discuss the war in Ukraine. The Kremlin stopped short of that, saying it could o...

item.title: How HR leaders can help employees affected by the Los Angeles wildfires
item.description: Setting up clear lines of communication, allowing worker flexibility, and helping affected employees access life-saving benefits are some basic moves.

item.title: Israeli Hostage Declared Killed in Gaza as Fears for Captives Mount
item.description: Hamza Ziyadne, 23, was abducted in the 2023 Hamas-led attack on Israel alongside his siblings and father, whose body was also recovered this week.

item.title: The justices are expected to rule quickly in the case.
item.description: The justices are expected to rule quickly in the case, which pits national security concerns about China against the First Amendment’s protection of f...

item.title: loupeWhat Dr. Ruth Left Behind
item.description: Archivists from the Kinsey Institute are helping the family of the sex therapist Ruth Westheimer with a common quandary: How much of someone’s stuff d...

item.title: Lebanon Turns a Political Page as Hezbollah’s Hold Is Weakened
item.description: A stinging defeat in war has left the once untouchable group on its most uncertain footing in years.

item.title: 2024’s Record-Breaking Heat Brought the World to a Dangerous Threshold. Now What?
item.description: Global temperatures last year crept past a key goal, raising questions about how much nations can stop the planet from heating up further.

item.title: Shui Ka-chun, Hong Kong Activist, Dies
item.description: A social worker and teacher imprisoned for his activism, he later wrote about the toll of incarceration and worked to help others behind bars.

item.title: Firefighters Battle Large Blaze at Bronx Apartment Building
item.description: Two hundred firefighters and emergency medical workers responded to the fire early Friday. Seven people have been injured and many residents displaced...

item.title: Jimmy Carter’s humanitarian legacy always included women’s rights
item.description: Carter championed the Equal Rights Amendment and appointed women to the federal bench.

item.title: Airbnb’s nonprofit wing helps LA fire victims find shelter, CFO says ‘right thing to do’
item.description: "In these moments of real stress for community members, we can mobilize our hosts," Ellie Mertz says.

item.title: Taiwan chip giant TSMC says its 2024 revenue rose more than 33% on soaring demand for AI technology
